greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of consecutive numbers >= n having at least one square divisor > 1.
comment: The first time terms 0..7 occur is at n = 1, 4, 8, 48, 242, 844, 22020, 217070. - _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 22 2017
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: mu(k) = 0 for n <= k < n+a(n) and mu(n+a(n)) <> 0, where mu = A008683 (Moebius function).
example: For n = 3, 3 is a squarefree number, thus a(3) = 0.
For n = 48, neither 48 = 2^4 * 3 nor 49 = 7^2, nor 50 = 2^2 * 5 are squarefree, but 51 = 3*17 is, thus a(48) = 3. - _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 22 2017
mathematica: Flatten@ Map[If[First@ # == 0, #, Reverse@ Range@ Length@ #] &, SplitBy[Table[DivisorSum[n, 1 &, And[# > 1, IntegerQ@ Sqrt@ #] &], {n, 120}], # > 0 &]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 22 2017 *)
program: (PARI) A081221(n) = { my(k=0); while(!issquarefree(n+k),k++); k; }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 22 2017
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 10 2003
